times-29453-22a.clue: Friend taking minute to finish piano exam out of time (9)

steps.hint: Existing outside of time — timeless
'Taking' signals a rearrangement — it tells you to take letters and move them around

transforms.hint: A friend is a mate — one of the most common synonyms in cryptics
'Taking minute to finish' tells you to move M (minute) to the end of MATE — rearranging the letters gives ATEM
In music, P means piano (soft) — a standard abbreviation in cryptics
A spoken exam is an oral — a common crossword synonym

steps.failMessage: The raw clue words don't fit — what does each one really mean?

steps.hint: A 'see' is a diocese — who runs one?
No indicator words here — the parts just join end to end. That's a charade.

transforms.hint: British slang for making a mistake or bungling something
In cryptics, 'work' nearly always means OP (short for opus). One to remember!

steps.hint: A simple past tense word — something that occurred
'Absence' tells you something is missing — a letter needs to be removed
'Conflicts' is the word that will lose a letter

transforms.hint: 'Conflicts' means 'wars' — armed conflicts are wars
'Republican's absence' means remove R (the standard abbreviation for Republican) from WARS

steps.failMessage: 'Conflicts' doesn't work directly — what shorter word does it point to?

times-29453-13a.clue: Moderate movement also opposed to one referendum option (9)

steps.hint: A musical tempo marking — moderately slow, between adagio and allegro
No indicator words here — the parts just join end to end. That's a charade.

transforms.hint: 'Also' is another way of saying 'and' — they both link things together
'Opposed to' means 'anti' — the prefix meaning against
In a referendum, the two options are Yes and No — 'one referendum option' is NO

times-29453-12a.clue: Concerning sight as head of office IT struggles with PC (5)

steps.hint: Related to vision or the eye — think of an optician
take the first letter of the next word
difficulty or disorder — a classic signal to rearrange letters

transforms.hint: 'Head of office' means take the first letter — the 'head' — of the word 'office'
'IT' is used as-is — it contributes both its letters
'PC' is used as-is — it contributes both its letters
Rearrange O + IT + PC (5 letters) — what word meaning 'concerning sight' can you make?

times-29453-4a.clue: Twit copying antique with pine, mostly (8)

steps.hint: To criticize or scold someone
'Mostly' means not all of it — take most of a word and drop the last letter

transforms.hint: A repro is a reproduction or copy of an antique
To pine is to ache — to long painfully for something
'Mostly' means take most of the letters — drop the last one

times-29453-10a.clue: Flatter track takes very little time (5-4)

steps.hint: To cajole or charm someone with persuasive words
To 'take' something is to absorb or contain it — one word goes inside another
Which word provides the letters that wrap around the inner part?
The remaining words build the inner part — two small clues that join together before being inserted.

transforms.hint: To 'track' someone is to follow or stalk them
'Very little' — a Scottish word for tiny
T is the standard crossword abbreviation for 'time'

times-29453-8d.clue: Steamy in here, but you must wear socks (8)

steps.hint: A warm glass building for growing plants — a greenhouse
To wear something is to put it around you — the outside wraps around the inside
What gets wrapped around the outside? Think of another word for socks.
What goes inside? An archaic form of 'you'.

transforms.hint: 'Socks' are 'hose' — an old word for stockings that's still common in cryptics
'You' in archaic English is 'thou' — Shakespeare's favourite pronoun

times-29453-1a.clue: Cover up in shower? Not after nurses turn round (6)

steps.hint: Something you use to stay dry when it rains
To nurse something is to hold or cradle it — one word wraps around another
The indicator tells you this word gets stretched — which pair wraps around the other?
Which remaining words get placed inside?

transforms.hint: 'Not after' means before — another word for that is BY
To 'turn round' is to 'roll' — a simple synonym

times-29453-25a.clue: Urge removal of line from silly speech (5)

steps.hint: To push or propel forward — 'drive' can mean to urge someone on
'Removal' means something is being taken away — a letter needs to go
'Silly speech' is the phrase that points to the word you'll delete a letter from

transforms.hint: Drivel is silly, nonsensical speech — a perfect synonym
'Removal of line from' means remove L — in cryptics, 'line' is a standard abbreviation for the letter L

steps.failMessage: 'Silly speech' doesn't work directly — what shorter word does it point to?

times-29453-21d.clue: Sailor in the doldrums relatively OK for tobacco? (3-3)

steps.hint: A description of cigarettes with reduced harmful content
No indicator words here — the parts just join end to end. That's a charade.

transforms.hint: To be 'in the doldrums' is to feel low — depressed or down
'Tar' is old slang for a sailor — 'Jack Tar' was the classic term for a naval man

steps.hint: Support or protection from someone powerful — think of acting 'under the auspices of' an organisation
'Welcoming' suggests receiving something into yourself — one word opens up to let another in
'Summits' is the host — it 'welcomes' something into itself
'American' is the guest being welcomed in

transforms.hint: Summits = peaks. The plural of 'apex' is a less common word — think Latin plurals
A two-letter abbreviation for American that you see every day

steps.failMessage: Put the short word for 'American' inside the short word for 'Summits'. The letters should spell the answer.

times-29453-24a.clue: Couple taken with second sight of Florence? (5)

steps.hint: A famous cathedral — one of the great sights of an Italian city
No indicator words here — the parts just join end to end. That's a charade.

transforms.hint: A 'couple' is a 'duo' — a pair of two
A 'second' of time is a 'mo' — short for moment

times-29453-28a.clue: Tsar’s like, roughly level after revolution (6)

steps.hint: A Roman emperor — the word 'Tsar' itself derives from this title
'Revolution' means a full turn — letters get reversed

transforms.hint: 'Roughly' points to CA — short for 'circa', the Latin word meaning approximately
To 'level' ground is to 'rase' it — an archaic spelling of 'raze'
'Revolution' tells you to reverse RASE → ESAR

steps.failMessage: 'Roughly' and 'level' don't work as-is — what does each really mean?

times-29453-3d.clue: One missing initially, admitted to Electra with some upheaval? (9)

steps.hint: Someone who arrives after things have started — they were the one missing
take the first letter of each word
'Some upheaval' suggests things being shaken up — letters need rearranging

transforms.hint: 'Initially' takes the first letter of each word before the comma. 'One missing' → O + M = OM.
'Electra' is a proper noun used as-is — 'admitted to Electra' means the letters are admitted to (added to) ELECTRA
'Some upheaval' tells you to rearrange OM + ELECTRA. What 9-letter word meaning 'one missing' can you make?

times-29453-23d.clue: Pretend authority raised undue spending limits (5)

steps.hint: A pretentious person who claims expertise or knowledge they don’t have
Two separate words work together as the indicator. 'Raised' in a down clue means reversed (going upward), and 'limits' tells you the letters are bounded within other words — a hidden reversed word.
The answer is hiding inside these words, spelled backwards. Look for a 5-letter sequence running across the word boundary.

transforms.hint: Look at where 'undue' ends and 'spending' begins — run the letters together: un-D-U-E-S-P-ending. The 5-letter sequence DUESP spans the boundary.
'Raised' in a down clue means read upwards — reverse DUESP to get PSEUD.

times-29453-19a.clue: Are cold kissers coming inside only when it’s dark? (5,7)

steps.hint: An astronomical event that temporarily blocks sunlight
'Coming inside' tells you something is being placed inside something else
Which word provides the letters that wrap around the inner part?
The remaining words build the inner part — three separate clues that join together before being inserted.

transforms.hint: 'Only' as in 'the sole survivor' — a straightforward synonym
Sometimes a word in the clue is used at face value — 'Are' appears as-is in the answer
C is the standard abbreviation for 'cold' — you'll see it on taps and in weather notation
'Kissers' is informal slang for lips

times-29453-11a.clue: Come by five, do you mean? (5)

steps.hint: 'Come by' means to drop in on someone — a common 5-letter word
No indicator words here — the parts just join end to end. That's a charade.

transforms.hint: Roman numerals are everywhere in cryptics. Five = V. One to remember!
'Do you mean?' is another way of asking 'is it?' — read it aloud

times-29453-5d.clue: A lot of sharp turns, I’m afraid (3)

steps.hint: An exclamation of fright, often seen in comics
'A lot of' means you take most of something — drop a letter from the end
This is the word the deletion indicator is acting on
'Turns' means to spin around — read the letters backwards

transforms.hint: Keen means sharp, as in a keen edge or a keen blade
'A lot of' means take most of the letters — drop the last one
'Turns' tells you to reverse the letters

steps.failMessage: So 'sharp' doesn't work as-is. What does 'sharp' really mean?

times-29453-2d.clue: Crooked old mater — which strongly suggests criminal is mum (6)

steps.hint: The mafia code of silence — if you follow it, you keep quiet about crimes
'Crooked' means bent or out of shape — a classic signal to rearrange letters
Look at what sits next to the indicator — those are the letters you need to rearrange

transforms.hint: In cryptics, 'old' nearly always means O. One to remember!
'mater' is used as-is — it provides all 5 of its letters
'Crooked' tells you to rearrange O + MATER. What 6-letter word can you make?

steps.failMessage: 'old mater' gives you 8 letters, but the answer is only 6. So what does each word really mean?

times-29453-18d.clue: Fugitive’s attempt to escape upset good egg (8)

steps.hint: Passing quickly, transient — like something that doesn't last
'Upset' means turned upside down — letters get reversed

transforms.hint: To 'attempt to escape' is to 'flee' — to run away
In cryptics, 'good' is almost always G — a standard abbreviation
An 'egg' of a louse is a 'nit' — a tiny egg that sticks to hair
'Upset' reverses G + NIT → GNIT → TING

steps.failMessage: 'Attempt to escape' and 'good egg' are too long — what does each really mean?

steps.hint: A traditional long garment worn in Middle Eastern countries
'Misrepresented' means shown wrongly — the letters have been jumbled up
'ad has' gives you the letters A-D-H-A-S to rearrange

transforms.hint: In slang, a 'dish' is a beautiful or attractive person — a common crossword synonym for beauty
'ad has' provides the raw letters A-D-H-A-S — taken at face value before rearranging
'Misrepresented' tells you to rearrange ADHAS — the letters shuffle into DASHA

transforms.hint: A 'rave' is a dance party — an all-night electronic music event

steps.hint: An island nation off the coast of Africa

transforms.hint: 'Out to lunch' is slang for crazy — and in cryptics, crazy almost always means MAD
An aga is a Turkish military commander — a classic crossword word
In cryptics, the apostrophe-s in contractions like 'who's' smuggles in the letter S — a classic setter trick
A coach is a type of vehicle — and CAR is the short synonym setters love

steps.hint: A female diplomat who represents her nation abroad

steps.hint: Describing a place battered by strong winds
'Back' means going in reverse — read the letters backwards
'In' tells you one piece goes inside another

transforms.hint: To wind a handle is to turn it — WIND (rhymes with 'find') means to turn
A pew is a church bench — a classic crossword synonym
'Back' tells you to reverse PEW — reading it backwards gives WEP
ST is the standard abbreviation for street — one of the most common in cryptics
'In' tells you WEP goes inside ST — S + WEP + T = SWEPT

times-29453-14d.clue: Photos I had mounted cover the inside of school (10)

steps.hint: To train or teach someone — 'to school' someone means to discipline them
'Mounted' means going up — in a down clue, that means reading letters upwards (backwards)
Look at the words between the definition and the indicator — 'Photos I had' is the material that gets reversed

transforms.hint: Photos are pics — a very common informal synonym
'I had' contracts to 'I'd' — and in cryptics, contractions like I'd give you the letters ID
'Mounted' tells you to reverse PICSID — reading it backwards gives DISCIP
To line a coat is to cover its inside — LINE is the synonym here

steps.hint: A famous structure on the Nile river

transforms.hint: Robert Adam was a famous British architect

times-29453-27a.clue: See Dogma remade as massive hit (8)

steps.hint: A very large amount of something — especially medicine
'Remade' means reconstructed — the letters need to be rearranged into something new
'See Dogma' — these 8 letters will rearrange into the answer

transforms.hint: 'See' is used as-is — its 3 letters go directly into the anagram
'Dogma' is used as-is — its 5 letters go directly into the anagram
Rearrange S + E + E + D + O + G + M + A — what 8-letter word meaning 'massive hit' can you make?

times-29453-20d.clue: Many academics divided by gender-neutral pronoun (6)

steps.hint: A word meaning a large number of something
To divide something is to split it apart — one word gets broken open so another can go in between
Which word gets split apart to wrap around the other?
What goes inside the split?

transforms.hint: In British English, 'academics' are 'dons' — university fellows at Oxford and Cambridge
'Ze' is a modern gender-neutral pronoun — a less common word that cryptic setters love
